name: Monferno
description: It uses ceilings and walls to launch aerial attacks. Its fiery tail is but one weapon.

name: Infernape
description: It tosses its enemies around with agility. It uses all its limbs to fight in its own unique style.

name: Prinplup
description: It lives a solitary life. Its wings deliver wicked blows that can snap even the thickest of trees.

name: Empoleon
description: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.

name: Starly
description: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokémon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.

name: Staravia
description: It lives in forests and fields. Squabbles over territory occur when flocks collide.

name: Staraptor
description: When Staravia evolve into Staraptor, they leave the flock to live alone. They have sturdy wings.

name: Bidoof
description: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.

name: Bibarel
description: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.

name: Kricketot
description: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.

name: Kricketune
description: It signals its emotions with its melodies. Scientists are studying these melodic patterns.

name: Shinx
description: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

name: Luxio
description: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

name: Luxray
description: Luxray’s ability to see through objects comes in handy when it’s scouting for danger.

name: Budew
description: Over the winter, it closes its bud and endures the cold. In spring, the bud opens and releases pollen.

name: Roserade
description: With the movements of a dancer, it strikes with whips that are densely lined with poison thorns.

name: Cranidos
description: A lifelong jungle dweller from 100 million years ago, it would snap obstructing trees with headbutts.

name: Rampardos
description: Its skull is as hard as iron. It is a brute that tears down jungle trees while catching prey.

name: Shieldon
description: It was generated from a fossil dug out of a layer of clay that was older than anyone knows. It has a sturdy face.

name: Bastiodon
description: Any frontal attack is repulsed. It is a docile Pokémon that feeds on grass and berries.

name: Burmy
description: If its cloak is broken in battle, it quickly remakes the cloak with materials nearby.

name: Mothim
description: It flutters around at night and steals honey from the Combee hive.

name: Combee
description: It collects and delivers honey to its colony. At night, they cluster to form a beehive and sleep.

name: Vespiquen
description: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by Combee.

name: Pachirisu
description: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

name: Buizel
description: It inflates the flotation sac around its neck and pokes its head out of the water to see what is going on.

name: Floatzel
description: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. It can double as a rubber raft.

name: Cherubi
description: It evolves by sucking the energy out of the small ball where it had been storing nutrients.

name: Cherrim
description: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun’s rays with its whole body.

name: Shellos
description: Its shape and coloration vary, depending on its habitat.

name: Gastrodon
description: It apparently had a huge shell for protection in ancient times. It lives in shallow tidal pools.

name: Ambipom
description: To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails. It rarely uses its arms now.

name: Drifloon
description: These Pokémon are called the “Signpost for Wandering Spirits.” Children holding them sometimes vanish.

name: Drifblim
description: It’s drowsy in daytime, but flies off in the evening in big groups. No one knows where they go.

name: Buneary
description: When it senses danger, it perks up its ears. On cold nights, it sleeps with its head tucked into its fur.

name: Lopunny
description: The ears appear to be delicate. If they are touched roughly, it kicks with its graceful legs.

name: Mismagius
description: Its cries sound like incantations to torment the foe. It appears where you least expect it.

name: Honchkrow
description: Becoming active at night, it is known to swarm with numerous Murkrow in tow.

name: Glameow
description: When it’s happy, Glameow demonstrates beautiful movements of its tail, like a dancing ribbon.

name: Purugly
description: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.

name: Stunky
description: It protects itself by spraying a noxious fluid from its rear. The stench lingers for 24 hours.

name: Skuntank
description: It sprays a stinky fluid from its tail. The fluid smells worse the longer it is allowed to fester.

name: Bronzong
description: Ancient people believed that petitioning Bronzong for rain was the way to make crops grow.

name: Bonsly
description: It prefers an arid atmosphere. It leaks water that looks like tears when adjusting its moisture level.

name: Mime-jr
description: It habitually mimics foes. Once mimicked, the foe cannot take its eyes off this Pokémon.

name: Happiny
description: It carefully carries a round, white rock that it thinks is an egg. It’s bothered by how curly its hair looks.

name: Chatot
description: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.

name: Spiritomb
description: It was bound to a fissure in an odd keystone as punishment for misdeeds 500 years ago.

name: Gible
description: It nests in small, horizontal holes in cave walls. It pounces to catch prey that stray too close.

name: Gabite
description: As it digs to expand its nest, it habitually digs up gems that it then hoards in its nest.

name: Garchomp
description: It flies at speeds equal to a jet fighter plane. It never allows its prey to escape.

name: Munchlax
description: It conceals food under the long fur on its body. It carts around this food stash and swallows it without chewing.

name: Riolu
description: The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to alert others if it is afraid or sad.

name: Lucario
description: By reading the auras of all things, it can tell how others are feeling from over half a mile away.

name: Hippopotas
description: It enshrouds itself with sand to protect itself from germs. It does not enjoy getting wet.

name: Hippowdon
description: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.

name: Skorupi
description: It burrows under the sand to lie in wait for prey. Its tail claws can inject its prey with a savage poison.

name: Drapion
description: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.

name: Croagunk
description: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.

name: Toxicroak
description: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.

name: Carnivine
description: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.

name: Finneon
description: After long exposure to sunlight, the patterns on its tail fins shine vividly when darkness arrives.

name: Lumineon
description: To avoid detection by predators, it crawls along the seafloor using the two fins on its chest.

name: Mantyke
description: When it swims close to the surface of the ocean, people aboard ships are able to observe the pattern on its back.

name: Snover
description: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.

name: Abomasnow
description: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.

name: Magnezone
description: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.

name: Lickilicky
description: Their saliva contains lots of components that can dissolve anything. The numbness caused by their lick does not dissipate.

name: Rhyperior
description: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. Geodude are shot at rare times.

name: Tangrowth
description: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can’t even see its eyes.

name: Electivire
description: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of power.

name: Magmortar
description: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit out of its arms. Its breath also sears and sizzles.

name: Togekiss
description: It shares many blessings with people who respect one another’s rights and avoid needless strife.

name: Yanmega
description: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.

name: Leafeon
description: Just like a plant, it uses photosynthesis. As a result, it is always enveloped in clear air.

name: Glaceon
description: It lowers its body heat to freeze its fur. The hairs then become like needles it can fire.

name: Gliscor
description: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey… Then its elongated fangs do the rest.

name: Mamoswine
description: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The population thinned when it turned warm after the ice age.

name: Gallade
description: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using extending swords on its elbows.

name: Probopass
description: It freely controls three small units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force.

name: Dusknoir
description: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.

name: Froslass
description: Legends in snowy regions say that a woman who was lost on an icy mountain was reborn as Froslass.

name: Rotom
description: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

name: Uxie
description: It is said that its emergence gave humans the intelligence to improve their quality of life.

name: Mesprit
description: It sleeps at the bottom of a lake. Its spirit is said to leave its body to fly on the lake’s surface.

name: Azelf
description: It is thought that Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf all came from the same egg.

name: Dialga
description: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

name: Palkia
description: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.

name: Heatran
description: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.

name: Regigigas
description: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.

name: Cresselia
description: Those who sleep holding Cresselia’s feather are assured of joyful dreams. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

name: Phione
description: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.

name: Manaphy
description: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokémon.

name: Darkrai
description: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.

name: Arceus
description: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.

name: Victini
description: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being’s entire body will be overflowing with power.

name: Snivy
description: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.

name: Servine
description: When it gets dirty, its leaves can’t be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.

name: Serperior
description: It can stop its opponents’ movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.

name: Tepig
description: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.

name: Pignite
description: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.

name: Emboar
description: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.

name: Oshawott
description: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.

name: Dewott
description: As a result of strict training, each Dewott learns different forms for using the scalchops.

name: Samurott
description: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.

name: Patrat
description: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won’t notice a foe coming from behind.

name: Watchog
description: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.

name: Lillipup
description: Though it is a very brave Pokémon, it’s also smart enough to check its foe’s strength and avoid battle.

name: Herdier
description: It has black, cape-like fur that is very hard and decreases the amount of damage it receives.

name: Stoutland
description: Being wrapped in its long fur is so comfortable that a person would be fine even overnight on a wintry mountain.

name: Purrloin
description: They steal from people for fun, but their victims can’t help but forgive them. Their deceptively cute act is perfect.

name: Liepard
description: Stealthily, it sneaks up on its target, striking from behind before its victim has a chance to react.

name: Pansage
description: It’s good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It’s kind enough to share them with friends.

name: Simisage
description: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.

name: Pansear
description: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Simisear
description: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.

name: Panpour
description: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.

name: Simipour
description: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.

name: Munna
description: It eats the dreams of people and Pokémon. When it eats a pleasant dream, it expels pink-colored mist.

name: Musharna
description: The dream mist coming from its forehead changes into many different colors depending on the dream that was eaten.

name: Pidove
description: These Pokémon live in cities. They are accustomed to people. Flocks often gather in parks and plazas.

name: Tranquill
description: No matter where in the world it goes, it knows where its nest is, so it never gets separated from its Trainer.

name: Unfezant
description: Males have plumage on their heads. They will never let themselves feel close to anyone other than their Trainers.

name: Zebstrika
description: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

name: Roggenrola
description: They were discovered a hundred years ago in an earthquake fissure. Inside each one is an energy core.

name: Boldore
description: When it is healthy, its core sticks out. Always facing the same way, it swiftly moves front to back and left to right.

name: Gigalith
description: Compressing the energy from its internal core lets it fire off an attack capable of blowing away a mountain.

name: Woobat
description: The heart-shaped mark left on a body after a Woobat has been attached to it is said to bring good fortune.

name: Swoobat
description: Anyone who comes into contact with the ultrasonic waves emitted by a courting male experiences a positive mood shift.

name: Drilbur
description: By spinning its body, it can dig straight through the ground at a speed of 30 mph.

name: Excadrill
description: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.

name: Audino
description: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.

name: Timburr
description: Always carrying squared logs, they help out with construction. As they grow, they carry bigger logs.

name: Gurdurr
description: This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.

name: Conkeldurr
description: Rather than rely on force, they master moves that utilize the centrifugal force of spinning concrete.

name: Palpitoad
description: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to immobilize its opponents.

name: Seismitoad
description: They shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps. They use vibration to hurt their opponents.

name: Throh
description: When it encounters a foe bigger than itself, it wants to throw it. It changes belts as it gets stronger.

name: Sawk
description: Tying their belts gets them pumped and makes their punches more destructive. Disturbing their training angers them.

name: Sewaddle
description: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.

name: Swadloon
description: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.

name: Leavanny
description: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.

name: Venipede
description: Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze large bird Pokémon that try to prey on it.

name: Whirlipede
description: It is usually motionless, but when attacked, it rotates at high speed and then crashes into its opponent.

name: Scolipede
description: With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.

name: Cottonee
description: Perhaps because they feel more at ease in a group, they stick to others they find. They end up looking like a cloud.

name: Whimsicott
description: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. It leaves balls of white fluff behind.

name: Petilil
description: Since they prefer moist, nutrient-rich soil, the areas where Petilil live are known to be good for growing plants.

name: Lilligant
description: Even veteran Trainers face a challenge in getting its beautiful flower to bloom. This Pokémon is popular with celebrities.

name: Sandile
description: They live buried in the sands of the desert. The sun-warmed sands prevent their body temperature from dropping.

name: Krokorok
description: The special membrane covering its eyes can sense the heat of objects, so it can see its surroundings even in darkness.

name: Krookodile
description: They never allow prey to escape. Their jaws are so powerful, they can crush the body of an automobile.

name: Darumaka
description: When it sleeps, it pulls its limbs into its body and its internal fire goes down to 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Maractus
description: Arid regions are their habitat. They move rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.

name: Dwebble
description: When it finds a stone of a suitable size, it secretes a liquid from its mouth to open up a hole to crawl into.

name: Crustle
description: Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.

name: Scraggy
description: Proud of its sturdy skull, it suddenly headbutts everything, but its weight makes it unstable, too.

name: Scrafty
description: It can smash concrete blocks with its kicking attacks. The one with the biggest crest is the group leader.

name: Sigilyph
description: The guardians of an ancient city, they always fly the same route while keeping watch for invaders.

name: Yamask
description: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.

name: Cofagrigus
description: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.

name: Tirtouga
description: Restored from a fossil, this Pokémon can dive to depths beyond half a mile.

name: Carracosta
description: It could knock out a foe with a slap from one of its developed front appendages and chew it up, shell or bones and all.

name: Archen
description: Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon, they were unable to fly and moved about by hopping from one branch to another.

name: Archeops
description: It runs better than it flies. It takes off into the sky by running at a speed of 25 mph.

name: Trubbish
description: Inhaling the gas they belch will make you sleep for a week. They prefer unsanitary places.

name: Garbodor
description: Consuming garbage makes new kinds of poison gases and liquids inside their bodies.

name: Zorua
description: To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokémon.

name: Minccino
description: These Pokémon prefer a tidy habitat. They are always sweeping and dusting, using their tails as brooms.

name: Cinccino
description: Cinccino’s body is coated in a special oil that helps it deflect attacks, such as punches.

name: Gothita
description: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon. Apparently, they are looking at something that only Gothita can see.

name: Gothorita
description: According to many old tales, it creates friends for itself by controlling sleeping children on starry nights.

name: Gothitelle
description: They can predict the future from the placement and movement of the stars. They can see Trainers’ life spans.

name: Solosis
description: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.

name: Duosion
description: When their two divided brains think the same thoughts, their psychic power is maximized.

name: Reuniclus
description: When Reuniclus shake hands, a network forms between their brains, increasing their psychic power.

name: Ducklett
description: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.

name: Swanna
description: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.

name: Vanillite
description: This Pokémon formed from icicles bathed in energy from the morning sun. It sleeps buried in snow.

name: Vanillish
description: Snowy mountains are this Pokémon’s habitat. During an ancient ice age, they moved to southern areas.

name: Vanilluxe
description: Swallowing large amounts of water, they make snow clouds inside their bodies and, when angry, cause violent blizzards.

name: Deerling
description: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon’s fur. People use it to mark the seasons.

name: Sawsbuck
description: They migrate according to the seasons, so some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring.

name: Karrablast
description: For some reason they evolve when they receive electrical energy while they are attacking Shelmet.

name: Escavalier
description: These Pokémon evolve by wearing the shell covering of a Shelmet. The steel armor protects their whole body.

name: Foongus
description: It lures Pokémon with its pattern that looks just like a Poké Ball, then releases poison spores.

name: Frillish
description: If its veil-like arms stun and wrap a foe, that foe will be dragged miles below the surface, never to return.

name: Jellicent
description: The fate of the ships and crew that wander into Jellicent’s habitat: all sunken, all lost, all vanished.

name: Alomomola
description: It gently holds injured and weak Pokémon in its fins. Its special membrane heals their wounds.

name: Joltik
description: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

name: Galvantula
description: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.

name: Ferroseed
description: It absorbs the iron it finds in the rock while clinging to the ceiling. It shoots spikes when in danger.

name: Ferrothorn
description: They attach themselves to cave ceilings, firing steel spikes at targets passing beneath them.

name: Klink
description: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.

name: Klang
description: A minigear and big gear comprise its body. If the minigear it launches at a foe doesn’t return, it will die.

name: Klinklang
description: Its red core functions as an energy tank. It fires the charged energy through its spikes into an area.

name: Tynamo
description: One alone can emit only a trickle of electricity, so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful electric shock.

name: Eelektrik
description: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.

name: Eelektross
description: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

name: Elgyem
description: Rumors of its origin are linked to a UFO crash site in the desert 50 years ago.

name: Beheeyem
description: It uses psychic power to control an opponent’s brain and tamper with its memories.

name: Litwick
description: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokémon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.

name: Lampent
description: It arrives near the moment of death and steals spirit from the body.

name: Axew
description: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.

name: Fraxure
description: A broken tusk will not grow back, so it diligently sharpens its tusks on river rocks after the end of a battle.

name: Haxorus
description: Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut steel beams. These Pokémon are covered in hard armor.

name: Cubchoo
description: Their snot is a barometer of health. When healthy, their snot is sticky and the power of their ice moves increases.

name: Beartic
description: It freezes its breath to create fangs and claws of ice to fight with. Cold northern areas are its habitat.

name: Cryogonal
description: They are composed of ice crystals. They capture prey with chains of ice, freezing the prey at -148 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Shelmet
description: It evolves when bathed in an electric-like energy along with Karrablast. The reason is still unknown.

name: Accelgor
description: When its body dries out, it weakens. So, to prevent dehydration, it wraps itself in many layers of thin membrane.

name: Stunfisk
description: It conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers a jolt of electricity.

name: Mienfoo
description: In fights, they dominate with onslaughts of flowing, continuous attacks. With their sharp claws, they cut enemies.

name: Mienshao
description: Using the long fur on its arms like whips, it launches into combo attacks that, once started, no one can stop.

name: Druddigon
description: It warms its body by absorbing sunlight with its wings. When its body temperature falls, it can no longer move.

name: Golett
description: Ancient science fashioned this Pokémon from clay. It’s been active for thousands of years.

name: Golurk
description: It flies across the sky at Mach speeds. Removing the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go out of control.

name: Pawniard
description: Ignoring their injuries, groups attack by sinking the blades that cover their bodies into their prey.

name: Bisharp
description: Bisharp pursues prey in the company of a large group of Pawniard. Then Bisharp finishes off the prey.

name: Bouffalant
description: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.

name: Rufflet
description: They will challenge anything, even strong opponents, without fear. Their frequent fights help them become stronger.

name: Braviary
description: They fight for their friends without any thought about danger to themselves. One can carry a car while flying.

name: Vullaby
description: Their wings are too tiny to allow them to fly. They guard their posteriors with bones that were gathered by Mandibuzz.

name: Mandibuzz
description: Watching from the sky, they swoop to strike weakened Pokémon on the ground. They decorate themselves with bones.

name: Heatmor
description: It draws in air through its tail, transforms it into fire, and uses it like a tongue. It melts Durant and eats them.

name: Durant
description: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.

name: Deino
description: Lacking sight, it’s unaware of its surroundings, so it bumps into things and eats anything that moves.

name: Zweilous
description: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.

name: Hydreigon
description: It responds to movement by attacking. This scary, three-headed Pokémon devours everything in its path!

name: Volcarona
description: When volcanic ash darkened the atmosphere, it is said that Volcarona’s fire provided a replacement for the sun.

name: Cobalion
description: It has a body and heart of steel. It worked with its allies to punish people when they hurt Pokémon.

name: Terrakion
description: Spoken of in legend, this Pokémon used its phenomenal power to destroy a castle in its effort to protect Pokémon.

name: Virizion
description: Legends say this Pokémon confounded opponents with its swift movements.

name: Reshiram
description: When Reshiram’s tail flares, the heat energy moves the atmosphere and changes the world’s weather.

name: Zekrom
description: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the Unova region. It creates electricity in its tail.

name: Genesect
description: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.

name: Chespin
description: Such a thick shell of wood covers its head and back that even a direct hit from a truck wouldn’t faze it.

name: Quilladin
description: They strengthen their lower bodies by running into one another. They are very kind and won’t start fights.

name: Chesnaught
description: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.

name: Fennekin
description: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.

name: Braixen
description: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.

name: Delphox
description: Using psychic power, it generates a fiery vortex of 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.

name: Froakie
description: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

name: Frogadier
description: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute’s time.

name: Greninja
description: It appears and vanishes with a ninja’s grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.

name: Bunnelby
description: It has ears like shovels. Digging holes strengthens its ears so much that they can sever thick roots effortlessly.

name: Fletchling
description: Despite the beauty of its lilting voice, it’s merciless to intruders that enter its territory.

name: Fletchinder
description: The hotter the flame sac on its belly, the faster it can fly, but it takes some time to get the fire going.

name: Talonflame
description: When attacking prey, it can reach speeds of up to 310 mph. It finishes its prey off with a colossal kick.

name: Scatterbug
description: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.

name: Spewpa
description: The beaks of bird Pokémon can’t begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.

name: Vivillon
description: The patterns on this Pokémon’s wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.

name: Litleo
description: They set off on their own from their pride and live by themselves to become stronger. These hot-blooded Pokémon are quick to fight.

name: Pyroar
description: With fiery breath of more than 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, they viciously threaten any challenger. The females protect the pride’s cubs.

name: Flabebe
description: When it finds a flower it likes, it dwells on that flower its whole life long. It floats in the wind’s embrace with an untroubled heart.

name: Floette
description: When the flowers of a well-tended flower bed bloom, it appears and celebrates with an elegant dance.

name: Florges
description: In times long past, governors of castles would invite Florges to create flower gardens to embellish the castle domains.

name: Skiddo
description: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn’t need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.

name: Gogoat
description: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.

name: Pangoro
description: It charges ahead and bashes its opponents like a berserker, uncaring about any hits it might take. Its arms are mighty enough to snap a telephone pole.

name: Furfrou
description: Historically, in the Kalos region, these Pokémon were the designated guardians of the king.

name: Espurr
description: It has enough psychic energy to blast everything within 300 feet of itself, but it has no control over its power.

name: Honedge
description: If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it wraps a blue cloth around that person’s arm and drains that person’s life energy completely.

name: Doublade
description: The complex attack patterns of its two swords are unstoppable, even for an opponent greatly accomplished at swordplay.

name: Spritzee
description: In the past, rather than using perfume, royal ladies carried a Spritzee that would waft a fragrance they liked.

name: Aromatisse
description: Its scent is so overpowering that, unless a Trainer happens to really enjoy the smell, he or she will have a hard time walking alongside it.

name: Swirlix
description: Because it eats nothing but sweets, its fur is as sticky sweet as cotton candy.

name: Slurpuff
description: Its sense of smell is 100 million times better than a human’s, so even the faintest scent tells it about everything in the area. It’s like it can see with its nose!

name: Inkay
description: It flashes the light-emitting spots on its body, which drains its opponent’s will to fight. It takes the opportunity to scuttle away and hide.

name: Malamar
description: It lures its prey close with hypnotic motions, then wraps its tentacles around it before finishing it off with digestive fluids.

name: Binacle
description: They stretch and then contract, yanking their rocks along with them in bold hops. They eat seaweed that washes up on the shoreline.

name: Barbaracle
description: Barbaracle’s legs and hands have minds of their own, and they will move independently. But they usually follow the head’s orders.

name: Skrelp
description: It looks just like rotten kelp. It hides from foes while storing up power for its evolution.

name: Dragalge
description: Tales are told of ships that wander into seas where Dragalge live, never to return.

name: Clauncher
description: Through controlled explosions of internal gas, it can expel water like a pistol shot. At close distances, it can shatter rock.

name: Clawitzer
description: By expelling water from the nozzle in the back of its claw, it can move at a speed of 60 knots.

name: Helioptile
description: The frills on either side of its head have cells that generate electricity when exposed to sunlight.

name: Heliolisk
description: It stimulates its muscles with electricity, boosting the strength in its legs and enabling it to run 100 yards in five seconds.

name: Tyrunt
description: Its immense jaws have enough destructive force that it can chew up an automobile. It lived 100 million years ago.

name: Tyrantrum
description: Nothing could stop this Pokémon 100 million years ago, so it behaved like a king.

name: Amaura
description: This calm Pokémon lived in a cold land where there were no violent predators like Tyrantrum.

name: Aurorus
description: Using its diamond-shaped crystals, it can instantly create a wall of ice to block an opponent’s attack.

name: Sylveon
description: It wraps its ribbonlike feelers around the arm of its beloved Trainer and walks with him or her.

name: Hawlucha
description: With its wings, it controls its position in the air. It likes to attack from above, a maneuver that is difficult to defend against.

name: Dedenne
description: It uses its tail to absorb electricity from power plants or from outlets in houses, and then it fires the electricity from its whiskers.

name: Carbink
description: It has slept underground for hundreds of millions of years since its birth. It’s occasionally found during the excavation of caves.

name: Goomy
description: It’s covered in a slimy membrane that makes any punches or kicks slide off it harmlessly.

name: Sliggoo
description: Its four horns are a high-performance radar system. It uses them to sense sounds and smells, rather than using ears or a nose.

name: Goodra
description: It attacks with retractable horns. It throws a punch that’s the equivalent of the force of a hundred pro boxers.

name: Klefki
description: It never lets go of a key that it likes, so people give it the keys to vaults and safes as a way to prevent crime.

name: Trevenant
description: Using its roots as a nervous system, it controls the trees in the forest. It’s kind to the Pokémon that reside in its body.

name: Bergmite
description: Using air of -150 degrees Fahrenheit, they freeze opponents solid. They live in herds above the snow line on mountains.

name: Avalugg
description: The way several Bergmite huddle on its back makes it look like an aircraft carrier made of ice.

name: Noibat
description: Even a robust wrestler will become dizzy and unable to stand when exposed to its 200,000-hertz ultrasonic waves.

name: Noivern
description: The ultrasonic waves it emits from its ears can reduce a large boulder to pebbles. It swoops out of the dark to attack.

name: Xerneas
description: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.

name: Yveltal
description: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.

name: Zygarde
description: It’s thought to be monitoring the ecosystem. There are rumors that even greater power lies hidden within it.

name: Diancie
description: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.

name: Hoopa
description: It is said to be able to seize anything it desires with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.

name: Volcanion
description: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.

name: Dartrix
description: It throws sharp feathers called blade quills at enemies or prey. It seldom misses.

name: Decidueye
description: Although basically cool and cautious, when it’s caught by surprise, it’s seized by panic.

name: Litten
description: It doesn’t allow its emotions to be easily seen. Earning its trust takes time. It prefers solitude.

name: Torracat
description: It boasts powerful front legs. With a single punch, it can bend an iron bar right over.

name: Incineroar
description: After hurling ferocious punches and flinging furious kicks, it finishes opponents off by spewing fire from around its navel.

name: Popplio
description: This Pokémon can control water bubbles. It practices diligently so it can learn to make big bubbles.

name: Brionne
description: It cares deeply for its companions. When its Trainer is feeling down, it performs a cheery dance to try and help.

name: Primarina
description: Its singing voice is its chief weapon in battle. This Pokémon’s Trainer must prioritize the daily maintenance of its throat at all costs.

name: Pikipek
description: This Pokémon feeds on berries, whose leftover seeds become the ammunition for the attacks it fires off from its mouth.

name: Trumbeak
description: By bending its beak, it can produce a variety of calls and brand itself a noisy nuisance for its neighbors.

name: Toucannon
description: Within its beak, its internal gas ignites, explosively launching seeds with enough power to pulverize boulders.

name: Yungoos
description: It wanders around in a never-ending search for food. At dusk, it collapses from exhaustion and falls asleep on the spot.

name: Gumshoos
description: It adores having Rattata and Raticate for dinner, but as it’s diurnal, it never encounters them. This Pokémon boasts incredible patience.

name: Grubbin
description: They often gather near places frequented by electric Pokémon in order to avoid being attacked by bird Pokémon.

name: Charjabug
description: From the food it digests, it generates electricity, and it stores this energy in its electric sac.

name: Vikavolt
description: It produces electricity via an electrical organ in its abdomen. It overwhelms bird Pokémon with shocking beams of electrical energy.

name: Crabrawler
description: It punches so much, its pincers often come off from overuse, but they grow back quickly. What little meat they contain is rich and delicious.

name: Crabominable
description: It just throws punches indiscriminately. In times of desperation, it can lop off its own pincers and fire them like rockets.

name: Cutiefly
description: Myriads of Cutiefly flutter above the heads of people who have auras resembling those of flowers.

name: Ribombee
description: Some of Ribombee’s pollen puffs are highly nutritious. They are sometimes sold as supplements.

name: Rockruff
description: This Pokémon has lived with people since times long ago. It can sense when its Trainer is in the dumps and will stick close by its Trainer’s side.

name: Mareanie
description: It’s found crawling on beaches and seafloors. The coral that grows on Corsola’s head is as good as a five-star banquet to this Pokémon.

name: Toxapex
description: Those attacked by Toxapex’s poison will suffer intense pain for three days and three nights. Post-recovery, there will be some aftereffects.

name: Mudbray
description: It has a stubborn, individualistic disposition. Eating dirt, making mud, and playing in the mire all form part of its daily routine.

name: Mudsdale
description: Its heavy, mud-covered kicks are its best means of attack, and it can reduce large trucks to scrap without breaking a sweat.

name: Dewpider
description: When it comes across enemies or potential prey, this Pokémon smashes its water-bubble-covered head into them.

name: Araquanid
description: Despite what its appearance suggests, it cares for others. If it finds vulnerable, weak Pokémon, it protectively brings them into its water bubble.

name: Fomantis
description: They give off a sweet and refreshing scent. Cutiefly often gather near the tall grass where Fomantis are hiding.

name: Lurantis
description: It fires beams from its sickle-shaped petals. These beams are powerful enough to cleave through thick metal plates.

name: Morelull
description: As it drowses the day away, it nourishes itself by sucking from tree roots. It wakens at the fall of night, wandering off in search of a new tree.

name: Shiinotic
description: It emits flickering spores that cause drowsiness. When its prey succumb to sleep, this Pokémon feeds on them by sucking in their energy.

name: Salandit
description: Volcanoes or dry, craggy places are its home. It emanates a sweet-smelling poisonous gas that attracts bug Pokémon, then attacks them.

name: Salazzle
description: Filled with pheromones, its poisonous gas can be diluted to use in the production of luscious perfumes.

name: Stufful
description: A touch from anyone except a known friend sends it into a surging frenzy. It’s an incredibly dangerous Pokémon.

name: Bewear
description: This Pokémon has the habit of hugging its companions. Many Trainers have left this world after their spines were squashed by its hug.

name: Bounsweet
description: Although it’s too sugary for human consumption, Bounsweet’s sweat can be watered down into a juice with just the right amount of sweetness.

name: Steenee
description: This Pokémon is always bouncing around energetically. Other Pokémon are attracted by its lively appearance and pleasant aroma.

name: Tsareena
description: A Pokémon known for the beauty of its well-shaped legs, it sometimes appears as a mascot in advertisements for beauty salons.

name: Comfey
description: Baths prepared with the flowers from its vine have a relaxing effect, so this Pokémon is a hit with many people.

name: Oranguru
description: Deep in the jungle, high in the lofty canopy, this Pokémon abides. On rare occasions, it shows up at the beach to match wits with Slowking.

name: Passimian
description: They battle with hard berries for weapons. Their techniques are passed from the boss to the group, generation upon generation.

name: Wimpod
description: Its habitat varies from beaches to seabeds. A natural scavenger, it will gleefully chow down on anything edible, no matter how rotten.

name: Golisopod
description: It battles skillfully with its six arms, but spends most of its time peacefully meditating in caves deep beneath the sea.

name: Sandygast
description: It takes control of anyone who puts a hand in its mouth. And so it adds to the accumulation of its sand-mound body.

name: Palossand
description: Buried beneath the castle are masses of dried-up bones from those whose vitality it has drained.

name: Pyukumuku
description: These Pokémon line the beaches. The sticky mucous that covers their bodies can be used to soothe sunburned skin. How convenient!

name: Silvally
description: Although its name was Type: Null at first, the boy who evolved it into this form gave it the name by which it is now known.

name: Komala
description: The log it holds was given to it by its parents at birth. It has also been known to cling to the arm of a friendly Trainer.

name: Turtonator
description: It gushes fire and poisonous gases from its nostrils. Its dung is an explosive substance and can be put to various uses.

name: Togedemaru
description: The long hairs on its back act as lightning rods. The bolts of lightning it attracts are stored as energy in its electric sac.

name: Drampa
description: This Pokémon is friendly to people and loves children most of all. It comes from deep in the mountains to play with children it likes in town.

name: Jangmo-o
description: They live in mountains where no trace of humans can be detected. Jangmo-o grow little by little as they battle one another.

name: Hakamo-o
description: It sheds and regrows its scales on a continuous basis. The scales become harder and sharper each time they’re regrown.

name: Kommo-o
description: Its rigid scales function as offense and defense. In the past, its scales were processed and used to make weapons and other commodities.

name: Tapu-koko
description: It confuses its enemies by flying too quickly for the eye to follow. It has a hair-trigger temper but forgets what made it angry an instant later.

name: Tapu-lele
description: As it flutters about, it scatters its strangely glowing scales. Touching them is said to restore good health on the spot.

name: Tapu-bulu
description: The guardian deity of Ula’ula is a lazy Pokémon. It commands plants to immobilize its foes and then deals them a savage blow with its horns.

name: Tapu-fini
description: The guardian deity of Poni, it can control water. People say it can create pure water that will wash away any uncleanness.

name: Solgaleo
description: This Pokémon is said to be a male evolution of Cosmog. At the activation of its third eye, it departs for another world.

name: Lunala
description: Said to live in another world, this Pokémon devours light, drawing the moonless dark veil of night over the brightness of day.

name: Nihilego
description: One of the Ultra Beasts. It’s unclear whether or not this Pokémon is sentient, but sometimes it can be observed behaving like a young girl.

name: Buzzwole
description: A mysterious life-form called an Ultra Beast. Witnesses saw it pulverize a dump truck with a single punch.

name: Pheromosa
description: One of the Ultra Beasts. It refuses to touch anything, perhaps because it senses some uncleanness in this world.

name: Xurkitree
description: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. It raided a power plant, so people think it energizes itself with electricity.

name: Celesteela
description: One kind of Ultra Beast. Witnesses have seen it burn down a forest by expelling gas from its two arms.

name: Kartana
description: One of the Ultra Beast life-forms, it was observed cutting down a gigantic steel tower with one stroke of its blade.

name: Guzzlord
description: A dangerous Ultra Beast, it appears to be eating constantly, but for some reason its droppings have never been found.

name: Necrozma
description: Light is apparently the source of its energy. It has an extraordinarily vicious disposition and is constantly firing off laser beams.

name: Marshadow
description: It sinks into the shadows of people and Pokémon, where it can understand their feelings and copy their capabilities.

name: Poipole
description: An Ultra Beast that lives in a different world, it cackles wildly as it sprays its opponents with poison from the needles on its head.

name: Naganadel
description: One kind of Ultra Beast, it fires a glowing, venomous liquid from its needles. This liquid is also immensely adhesive.

name: Stakataka
description: When stone walls started moving and attacking, the brute’s true identity was this mysterious life-form, which brings to mind an Ultra Beast.

name: Blacephalon
description: A UB that appeared from an Ultra Wormhole, it causes explosions, then takes advantage of opponents’ surprise to rob them of their vitality.
